message.content:
cs.MM, cs.NI, cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.HC

This paper is likely to belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category as it deals with the challenges of streaming 360{\deg} video content and improving the Quality of Experience (QoE) for viewers. Additionally, it may also fall under the Networked and Distributed Systems (cs.NI) sub-category as it discusses the distribution of content from the origin to the viewer. Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories are also possible as the paper involves analyzing the viewer's head orientation and movement based on sensor information and projecting the video content onto a virtual sphere. Finally, the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category may also be relevant as the paper aims to improve the user experience of consuming 360{\deg} video content.
